column4: im having trouble trying to understand the way space is being managed...
just a week ago i had to reinstall ubuntu because of lack of space..
now i have a fairly new machine and all of a sudden i see only 5.6G being free
what is taking up so much of space? /var/cache/apt/archives is 500M and i have a few other data that is at max worth about another 100M..
I have so far only installed vbox,nvidia drivers and thats about it.
where are you seeing your free disk space info?
did you type df -h in a terminal?
what is the size of the harddisk you have?
can you pastebin output of sudo fdisk -l please
all your disk space is there; you just need to mount the other partitions
yes.. i understand that.. but my question was where to find out why the / partition is gobbling up space?
fine.. i'll take a look at it.. Thanks for your help
you might have selected that as the / and everything else below it; normally it is a good idea to have separate partitions for /home /var etc etc
